title: The Altar of Incense and Holy Anointing
shortSummary: Exodus 30 details God's instructions for the altar of incense, the census offering, the laver for priestly purification, and the holy anointing oil and incense. These ordinances emphasize holiness, atonement, and the sacredness of worship, underscoring the need for purity and reverence in approaching God.
timeline: c. 1446 BC - The Exodus and Wilderness Tabernacle Instructions

keyCharacters.name: Moses
keyCharacters.description: The leader and mediator who receives God's detailed instructions for the tabernacle and priestly duties.

keyCharacters.name: Aaron
keyCharacters.description: The first high priest, responsible for burning incense on the altar and performing atonement rituals.

keyCharacters.name: The Children of Israel
keyCharacters.description: God's chosen people who are instructed to give the atonement offering and follow the prescribed worship practices.

definitions.definition: A durable, dense wood from the acacia tree used in sacred furniture, symbolizing strength and incorruptibility.
The act of making amends or reparation for sin, restoring the relationship between God and His people.
An ancient unit of weight and currency, approximately 11 grams, used here for the temple tax and offerings.
A basin for ceremonial washing, symbolizing purification before approaching God.
A sacred mixture of spices and olive oil used to consecrate the tabernacle, its furnishings, and priests, signifying sanctification.

outline.heading: The Altar of Incense
outline.description: God commands the construction of the altar of incense, made of shittim wood overlaid with gold, to be placed before the mercy seat. Aaron is instructed to burn incense morning and evening as a perpetual offering, symbolizing prayer and intercession.

outline.heading: The Census Offering
outline.description: God institutes a half-shekel atonement offering to be given by every Israelite over twenty years old during the census. This offering serves as a ransom for their souls and supports the tabernacle service, emphasizing the cost of holiness and communal responsibility.

outline.heading: The Bronze Laver for Purification
outline.description: Instructions are given for a bronze laver to be placed between the tabernacle and altar for Aaron and his sons to wash their hands and feet before ministering. This ritual washing underscores the necessity of purity in approaching God.

outline.heading: The Holy Anointing Oil
outline.description: God provides a precise recipe for the holy anointing oil used to consecrate the tabernacle, its furnishings, and the priests. The oil is to remain sacred and not be replicated or used on outsiders, highlighting God's holiness and the sanctity of His appointed worship.

outline.heading: The Sacred Incense
outline.description: God commands the making of a special incense blend for use only in the tabernacle before the testimony. Unauthorized making or use of this incense is strictly forbidden, reinforcing the theme of exclusive holiness in worship.

application: Approach God with reverence and purity, recognizing the importance of spiritual cleansing before worship.
Give sacrificially and equally in support of God's work, understanding that all believers are accountable before Him.
Respect the holiness of God's ordinances and avoid casual or unauthorized use of sacred things.
Commit to regular prayer and intercession, symbolized by the continual burning of incense before the Lord.

keyVerses.text: And Aaron shall make an atonement upon the horns of it once in a year with the blood of the sin offering of atonements: once in the year shall he make atonement upon it throughout your generations: it is most holy unto the LORD.
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights the yearly atonement ritual, emphasizing the seriousness of sin and the need for ongoing reconciliation with God.

keyVerses.text: This they shall give, every one that passeth among them that are numbered, half a shekel after the shekel of the sanctuary: (a shekel is twenty gerahs:) an half shekel shall be the offering of the LORD.
keyVerses.significance: It teaches the principle of equal giving before God, regardless of wealth, as a ransom for the soul.

keyVerses.text: And thou shalt speak unto the children of Israel, saying, This shall be an holy anointing oil unto me throughout your generations.
keyVerses.significance: This verse underscores the sacredness and enduring significance of the anointing oil in God's covenant worship.

keyVerses.text: Whosoever shall make like unto that, to smell thereto, shall even be cut off from his people.
keyVerses.significance: A solemn warning about the holiness of God's appointed worship and the consequences of disregarding His commands.
